Classes/SCArrayOfObjectsCell.html#/c:obj.name: dataStore
Classes/SCArrayOfObjectsCell.html#/c:obj.abstract: The data store that’s used to store and fetch the cell’s objects.

Classes/SCArrayOfObjectsCell.html#/c:obj.name: dataFetchOptions
Classes/SCArrayOfObjectsCell.html#/c:obj.abstract: The options used to fetch the cell’s items from dataStore.

Classes/SCArrayOfObjectsCell.html#/c:obj.name: items
Classes/SCArrayOfObjectsCell.html#/c:obj.abstract: The items fetched from the dataStore.

Classes/SCArrayOfObjectsCell.html#/c:obj.name: allowAddingItems
Classes/SCArrayOfObjectsCell.html#/c:obj.abstract: Allows/disables adding new objects to the items array. Default: TRUE.

Classes/SCArrayOfObjectsCell.html#/c:obj.name: allowDeletingItems
Classes/SCArrayOfObjectsCell.html#/c:obj.abstract: Allows/disables deleting new objects from the items array. Default: TRUE.

Classes/SCArrayOfObjectsCell.html#/c:obj.name: allowMovingItems
Classes/SCArrayOfObjectsCell.html#/c:obj.abstract: Allows/disables moving objects from one row to another. Default: TRUE.

Classes/SCArrayOfObjectsCell.html#/c:obj.name: allowEditDetailView
Classes/SCArrayOfObjectsCell.html#/c:obj.abstract: Allows/disables editing detail views for objects. Default: TRUE.

Classes/SCArrayOfObjectsCell.html#/c:obj.name: allowRowSelection
Classes/SCArrayOfObjectsCell.html#/c:obj.abstract: Allows/disables row selection. Default: TRUE.

Classes/SCArrayOfObjectsCell.html#/c:obj.name: autoSelectNewItemCell
Classes/SCArrayOfObjectsCell.html#/c:obj.abstract: Allows/disables automatic cell selection of newly created items. Default: FALSE.

Classes/SCArrayOfObjectsCell.html#/c:obj.name: displayItemsCountInBadgeView
Classes/SCArrayOfObjectsCell.html#/c:obj.abstract: Allows/disables displaying the number of objects in the cell’s badgeView. Default: TRUE.

Classes/SCArrayOfObjectsCell.html#/c:obj.name: detailSectionActions
Classes/SCArrayOfObjectsCell.html#/c:obj.abstract: The set of actions for the cell’s automatically generated detail section.

Classes/SCArrayOfObjectsCell.html#/c:obj.name: placeholderCell
Classes/SCArrayOfObjectsCell.html#/c:obj.abstract: When set to a valid cell object, ‘placeholderCell’ will be displayed when no items exist in the generated section. As soon as any items are added, this cell automatically disappears. Default: nil.

Classes/SCArrayOfObjectsCell.html#/c:obj.name: addNewItemCell
Classes/SCArrayOfObjectsCell.html#/c:obj.abstract: When set to a valid cell object, ‘addNewItemCell’ will be displayed as the last cell of the generated section, and will add a new item to the section whenever it gets tapped by the user. This cell can be used as an alternative to the section’s addButtonItem. Default: nil.

Classes/SCArrayOfObjectsCell.html#/c:obj.name: addNewItemCellExistsInNormalMode
Classes/SCArrayOfObjectsCell.html#/c:obj.abstract: When TRUE, addNewItemCell will be displayed in Normal Mode. Default: TRUE.

Classes/SCArrayOfObjectsCell.html#/c:obj.name: addNewItemCellExistsInEditingMode
Classes/SCArrayOfObjectsCell.html#/c:obj.abstract: When TRUE, addNewItemCell will be displayed in Editing Mode. Default: TRUE.

Classes/SCExpandCollapseCell.html.name: SCExpandCollapseCell
Classes/SCExpandCollapseCell.html.abstract: SCExpandCollapseCell is a special cell class that, once tapped, collapses its owner section’s contents into a single cell. When tapped again, it will expand the section’s contents to their original state.

Classes/SCFetchItemsCell.html.name: SCFetchItemsCell
Classes/SCFetchItemsCell.html.abstract: SCFetchItemsCell is a special cell that is automatically displayed by an SCArrayOfItemsSection when more section items need to be fetched. This is typically the case when the section’s dataFetchOptions property has specified a batchSize for the fetched items.

Classes/SCTheme.html.name: SCTheme
Classes/SCTheme.html.abstract: The SCTheme class enables CSS-like styling of UIView (or any of its subclasses). Using CSS-like text files, any UIView property with a supported data type can be set. Key-path property format is fully supported (e.g. layer.cornerRadius: 5). All pointer data types accept nil as value (e.g. backgroundView: nil;).
